resources.string:
L Speed is a non-profit and free application, we gained zero dollars from it (apart from the donation, of course!), this is fine for us, but development costs a lot of money to be running, we need internet, electricity, and food!

Because of this, we have added advertisements in the app, they are not intrusive and won't bother you, we promise! Clicking on them will help us more too!

Thanks for your understanding
Removes the unneeded and obsolete files generated by the system (logs, unused cached files, etc…)
Removes unnecessary caches generated by apps (cached images, etc…)
Removes all the caches generated on the /cache partition
Clears dalvik-cache of all apps, reboot is necessary after the operation has been done to prevent force closing
Enables junk cleaning automatically on every reboot
Trims device partitions to reduce read/write lags and improve performance, use only when needed
Enables file system trimming automatically on every reboot
Tweaks your current governor with an intelligent scaling system for optimum performance and battery life
Groups CPU tasks into the least cores as possible, possibly saving battery life
Improves and optimizes CPU performance, may drain battery faster
Boosts input - output operation to improves their performance
Extends input - output queue, slight battery drain but faster read / write speed
Increases read_ahead for a faster read/write speed
Remounts all EXT4 partitions with performance-improving mount options

Improves network browsing performance\nSmall net buffers will increase the network buffers size reasonably for each connection type (3G, WiFi, LTE, Edge, UMTS)\nBig net buffers will increase buffers bigger and it may affect your battery life while using network transfer
Improves mobile data transfer speed
Changes network DNS with one of the Google Public DNS (8.8.8.8 – 8.8.4.4)
Tunes Android native Stagefright player to stream online media files faster
Enables faster network type switching to save battery, use only if your carrier/network provider supports fast dormancy
Drop caches such as inodes, dentries and pagecaches to free up your device\'s RAM
Removes batterystats.bin to recalibrate your battery, reboot is necessary to complete the calibration
Forcefully stops Media Server process, use this to reduce heating and performance drops caused by Media Server
Improves performance at the cost of battery life\nIncreasing Seeder level will increase performance but battery life would drain faster

Changes the kernel related tunables with a more performance improving values

Light - Less tweaked values, closer to stock values

Heavy - Apply huge changes to the kernel tunables, increase performances with small impacts on battery life
Disables read/write debugging operations\nDisable logging such as ANR activity logging and unneeded logcats output logs, improves performance.
Disable kernel panic to avoid the annoying reboots if the used kernel is buggy and/or unstable
Improves kernel sleepers parameters used in deep sleep for better performance
Fsync safely keeps changed data intact during a case of system crash or sudden shutdown
Enables KSM, which is a memory-saving de-duplication feature which performs scans through the memory and finds duplicate pages, useful on low memory devices
Enables the hacky fast charging used in most custom kernel, this is not needed if your phone supports fast charging by default
Reduces the delay between WiFi active and sleep/inactive state, saves battery if WiFi network is used
Disables performance-limiting flag in system and additionally improve battery life\nCan cause instability
Improves quality in call sessions, may drain battery faster
Enhances battery life by tweaking the system
Improves jerky scrolling and additionally make scrolling smoother
Reduces the boot time by optimizing the system tweakable values
Increases the average bitrate and improve image quality by maximizing its quality
Improves user interface performance at the cost of battery life
Turns off the User Behavior Logging Service (HTC Sense only)\nDisables the Google Network Location\nSets the delay of time your phone starts to ring when you receive a call
Enables Qualcomm Assertive Display which adaptively enhances and improves display quality
This option restricts wlan wakelock from activating
This option restricts wlan_ctrl wakelock from activating
This option restricts wlan_rx wakelock from activating
This option restricts msm_hsic_host wakelock from activating
This option restricts bluesleep wakelock from activating
This option restricts smb135x wakelock from activating when power is disconnected
This option restricts sensor_ind wakelock from activating when Ambient Display is disabled

Improves performance when the system is running out of memory
Default - Device default configuration

Enabled - Kills apps on out-of-memory situation, this avoids the expensive tasklist scan

Disabled - The OOM killer will scan through the entire tasklist and select a task based on heuristics to kill, normally selects a rogue memory-hogging task that frees up a large amount of memory when killed

Controls the tendency of the kernel to reclaim the memory which is used for caching of directory and inode objects

Default - Device default parameter

Minimum - Less reclaiming. This will slightly improve your battery life but some performance loss is to be expected

Moderate - Keep the value a bit less than default one, improved battery life with less impact on performance

Doubled - Gives the device performance boost but with huge impact on battery life

Controls how much RAM can be used for a cache allocation

Medium - Use 100% of your physical RAM for cache allocations

Large - Use 100% of physical RAM and 50% of swap if it exist

Modifying the cache allocation may cause random freezes and performance drops
Optimize and fine tune heap sizes with recommended values, based on RAM and display density.
Fine tunes and optimizes Android Runtime for better performance and efficiency, this option applies to both Dalvik and ART
Optimize and fine tune zRAM based on recommended values and RAM size

Improves performance when low on memory
Calculates the LMK (LowMemoryKiller) settings based on your device's RAM and the chosen profile

Default - Device default configuration

Multitasking - Keep as many apps as possible in RAM

Balanced - A balance between multitasking and gaming profile

Gaming - Keep as less apps as possible and keep your game lagless

This option optimises Dalvik heap memory allocations, it also toggles several low RAM flags in the system, which disables fancy effects like extensive animations and statusbar tinting.\nIt may also reduce battery usage of some apps.
This is an example dialog, you can also do this to the other Example Tweak
Nearly all options on L Speed has explanation, long pressing them will reveal the explanation
Continue on, these examples are only used to show how things work in the app
Enables more customizations options, not for beginners without any experience
Switches theme to a darker look
Colorize navigation bar, if no navigation bar is detected then nothing will be colored
Use English instead of any system language currently used
Shows a toast/snackbar (positioned on the bottom) when a tweak is enabled
Use Fahrenheit instead of Celsius, shown in Battery Temperature of Dashboard
Period to wait before executing scripts on boot
Shows a notification when the app is starting up after booting
Select predefined L Speed profiles, these determines how L Speed will perform and change the system
